result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly A Knoll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Kimberly A Knoll in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, Court withholds sentence, probation 1 year, 5 days jail w/Huber, Jail start date 3/4/16 at 7:00 P.M. $443.00 costs, AODA and comply, no possession/consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia unless has valid prescription, no use/possession of alcohol per agent's discretion, follow all family court orders,

Defendant Kimberly A Knoll in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin and motioned for bond be amended to supervised contact with grandparents. Atty. Klopp objected, stated the GAL has approved supervised contact with J.T.  Atty. Klopp presented Exhibits 1&2, marked and reviewed by the judge. Rebuttal by ADA Genda. Crt. recessed to review family case. Court resumed, same appearances. Bond amended to "placement by defendant be consistent with family court order, (placement of BBK) Judge requested Exh. 3 be marked and placed in file.
Bail/bond hearing on February 26, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Kimberly A Knoll in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State is requesting bond modification or clarification.
